steps.content: In Audre Lorde’s poem “Father Son and Holy Ghost”, what is the number of the stanza in which some lines are indented?

plan: Search for the text of Audre Lorde's poem 'Father Son and Holy Ghost'.
Read through the poem to identify the stanzas and their formatting.
Look for any stanzas where some lines are indented.
Note the stanza number where the indentation occurs.

serp.title: Father Son and Holy Ghost - Audre Lorde
serp.content: I have not ever seen my father's grave. Not that his judgment eyes. have been forgotten. nor his great hands' print. on our evening doorknobs.

serp.content: By Audre Lorde. I have not ever seen my father's grave. Not that his judgment eyes have been forgotten nor his great hands' print

serp.title: Audre Lorde's "Father Son and Holy Ghost"
serp.content: 7 Mar 2024 — In Audre Lorde's "Father Son and Holy Ghost," the speaker is remembering her father. She emphasizes that she has not as yet visited her father's grave.

serp.title: Exploring Family Dynamics in 'Father Son and Holy Ghost' by
serp.content: Father Son and Holy Ghost By Audre Lorde I have not ever seen my father's grave. Not that his judgment eyes have been forgotten nor his great hands' print ...

serp.content: 3 May 2024 — Father Son and Holy Ghost by Audre Lorde. I have not ever seen my father's grave. Not that his judgment eyes have been forgotten nor his great hands' print.

steps.text:
Title: Father Son and Holy Ghost | The Poetry Foundation
=======================
Poems \& Poets

Topics \& ThemesFeaturesEvents \& ProgramsAbout Us [Poetry  Magazine](/poetrymagazine/) [October 2024](/poetrymagazine/issue/1600245/october-2024)[Subscribe](/poetrymagazine/subscribe)[Subscribe![October 2024](https://cdn-test.poetryfoundation.org/cdn-cgi/image/w=10,h=16,q=50,fit=contain,blur=3/content/images/oct2024-poetry-cover.png)![Sep2024 poetry cover](https://cdn-test.poetryfoundation.org/cdn-cgi/image/w=10,h=16,q=50,fit=contain,blur=3/content/images/sep2024-poetry-cover.jpg)](/poetrymagazine/issue/1600245/october-2024)[Poetry Foundation](/)[Poetry Foundation](/)Poetry Foundation* Poems \& Poets
* Topics \& Themes
* Features
* Events \& Programs
* About Us
 [Poetry  Magazine](/poetrymagazine/)[October 2024](/poetrymagazine/issue/1600245/october-2024)[Subscribe](/poetrymagazine/subscribe/)[Subscribe![October 2024](https://cdn-test.poetryfoundation.org/cdn-cgi/image/w=10,h=16,q=50,fit=contain,blur=3/content/images/oct2024-poetry-cover.png)![Sep2024 poetry cover](https://cdn-test.poetryfoundation.org/cdn-cgi/image/w=10,h=16,q=50,fit=contain,blur=3/content/images/sep2024-poetry-cover.jpg)](/poetrymagazine/issue/1600245/october-2024)![Poetry Foundation](/assets/images/logo-print.png)Father Son and Holy Ghost
=========================

By [Audre Lorde](/poets/audre-lorde)Share thisShareI have not ever seen my father’s grave.

 Not that his judgment eyes

 have been forgotten

 nor his great hands’ print

 on our evening doorknobs

             one half turn each night

             and he would come

             drabbled with the world’s business

             massive and silent

             as the whole day’s wish

             ready to redefine

             each of our shapes

 but now the evening doorknobs

 wait    and do not recognize us

 as we pass.

 Each week a different woman

 regular as his one quick glass

 each evening

 pulls up the grass his stillness grows

 calling it weed.

 Each week    a different woman

 has my mother’s face

 and he

 who time has    changeless

 must be amazed

 who knew and loved

 but one.

 My father died in silence

 loving creation

 and well\-defined response

 he lived    still judgments

 on familiar things

 and died    knowing

 a January 15th that year me.

 Lest I go into dust

 I have not ever seen my father’s grave.

Copyright Credit: Audre Lorde, “Father Son and Holy Ghost” from *Collected Poems of Audre Lorde.* Copyright © 1997 by The Audre Lorde Estate. Reprinted with the permission of W. W. Norton \& Company, Inc. This selection may not be reproduced, stored in a retrieval system, or transmitted in any form or by any means without the prior written permission of the publisher.Source: *Collected Poems of Audre Lorde* (W.
